column2: 1. To avoid becoming an aggressive driver, you should:
column4: Adjust your schedule to drive during times with the most highway traffic.
column8: Allow enough travel time to reach your destination on schedule.

column8: The divided highway on which drivers are traveling ends ahead.

column2: 5. When is it safe to pass another vehicle?
column4: When you are entering a curve and there are no oncoming vehicles.
column6: When you are driving through an intersection and there are no oncoming vehicles.
column8: Whenever signs and/or markings permit passing other vehicles.

column2: 7. You are considered to be driving under the influence when your blood alcohol concentration (BAC) is ____ or more.
10. Drivers can not pass a vehicle on the left if:
column4: they can not safely return to the right lane before they reach a solid yellow center line for the right lane.
column6: they approach the top of a hill on a two-way road and can not see over it.

column2: 21. While driving, you see a flooded roadway ahead. You should:
column4: stop your vehicle on the roadway.
column6: proceed through the flooded area with caution.
column8: turn around and find another route to get to your destination.

column2: 22. Your license can be suspended if you are under 21 and drive with a BAC of:
23. This road sign warns drivers that:
column4: the road will make a sharp turn to the right.
column6: left turns are not allowed at the intersection.
column8: another road enters the highway from the direction shown.

column2: 25. Drivers should use high beam headlights when:
column4: when they come within 50 feet of an oncoming vehicle.
column6: there are no oncoming vehicles approaching.
